definition: to train/to educate/to bring up/to nurture/education/culture/upbringing/early conditioning
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: Such was the coarse language of this bad, neglected boy.
sentences.chinese: 那個沒教養的壞孩子吉姆說起話來就是這麼粗俗。

sentences.english: Never to master one's anger is a mark of intemperance and lack of training.
sentences.chinese: 不能剋制怒氣是任性和缺乏教養的標誌。

sentences.english: A well-behaved pet is a beloved member of family.
sentences.chinese: 有教養的寵物是家庭可愛的一員。

sentences.english: Objective To study the relationship between attributional style and parenting in undergraduates.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究大學生歸因方式與父母教養方式的關係。

sentences.english: Kate's new boyfriend is a very couth youth.
sentences.chinese: 凱特的新男朋友是一個很有教養的年輕人。

sentences.english: So did you see where is the "uneducated" bull?
sentences.chinese: 有沒有看到那個沒教養的牛去哪了？

sentences.english: When necessary, he may also be taken in by the government for reeducation.
sentences.chinese: 在必要的時候，也可以由政府收容教養。

sentences.english: Do you think he ought to be taken out of his school and sent to the penitentiary ?
sentences.chinese: 你們難道認爲他應該被趕出校門，送進教養院？

sentences.english: She said he was a very good-looking man and a gentleman .
sentences.chinese: 據她說，他是一個風度翩翩，很有教養的人。

sentences.english: First part, Reeducation through Labor Review and Development.
sentences.chinese: 勞動教養制度的回顧和發展。
不文雅或沒有教養和品位。

sentences.english: It indicates that they lack the basic moral upbringing.
sentences.chinese: 這至少說明了那個缺乏最基本的教養。

sentences.english: That's more than I can say for the children of Sun Forks origined in this town for generations.
sentences.chinese: 在福克斯鎮上幾代都找不出這樣有教養的孩子。

sentences.english: Ways and means to give more self-cultivine.
sentences.chinese: 宣泄的道路和方式多與自身教養相關。

sentences.english: Both villagers and city dwellers are uncultured in India.
sentences.chinese: 在印度，村民和城市居民都沒有教養。

definition: to cultivate/to breed/to foster/to nurture/to educate/to groom (for a position)/education/fostering/culture (biology)
